detaileddescription.para: Includes spare room for transport layer header, e.g. UDP header. Use this if you intend to pass the pbuf to functions like udp_send().
Includes spare room for IP header. Use this if you intend to pass the pbuf to functions like raw_send().

Includes spare room for link layer header (ethernet header). Use this if you intend to pass the pbuf to functions like ethernet_output().
PBUF_LINK_HLEN

Includes spare room for additional encapsulation header before ethernet headers (e.g. 802.11). Use this if you intend to pass the pbuf to functions like netif->linkoutput().
PBUF_LINK_ENCAPSULATION_HLEN
Use this for input packets in a netif driver when calling netif->input() in the most common case - ethernet-layer netif driver.

pbuf data is stored in RAM, used for TX mostly, struct pbuf and its payload are allocated in one piece of contiguous memory (so the first payload byte can be calculated from struct pbuf). pbuf_alloc() allocates PBUF_RAM pbufs as unchained pbufs (although that might change in future versions). This should be used for all OUTGOING packets (TX).
pbuf data is stored in ROM, i.e. struct pbuf and its payload are located in totally different memory areas. Since it points to ROM, payload does not have to be copied when queued for transmission.
pbuf comes from the pbuf pool. Much like PBUF_ROM but payload might change so it has to be duplicated when queued before transmitting, depending on who has a 'ref' to it.

pbuf payload refers to RAM. This one comes from a pool and should be used for RX. Payload can be chained (scatter-gather RX) but like PBUF_RAM, struct pbuf and its payload are allocated in one piece of contiguous memory (so the first payload byte can be calculated from struct pbuf). Don't use this for TX, if the pool becomes empty e.g. because of TCP queuing, you are unable to receive TCP acks!

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* socket_err_fn) (u8 skt_num, err_t err)
memberdef.name: socket_err_fn

briefdescription.para: This Function prototype for tcp error callback functions. Called when receives a RST or is unexpectedly closed for any other reason. The corresponding socket is already freed when this callback is called!

parameterdescription.para: Is the socket number that returned by tls_socket_create function.
Error code to indicate why the socket has been closed ERR_ABRT: aborted through returning ERR_ABRT from within others callback functions ERR_RST: the connection was reset by the remote host

memberdef.definition: typedef err_t(* socket_recv_fn) (u8 skt_num, struct pbuf *p, err_t err)
memberdef.name: socket_recv_fn

briefdescription.para: This Function prototype for socket receive callback functions. Called when data has been received.

parameterdescription.para: Is the socket number that returned by tls_socket_create function.
The received data (or NULL when the connection has been closed!)
An error code if there has been an error receiving, always be ERR_OK when cs mode is udp.

return value is only valid for tcp receive, for upd it means nothing. ERR_OK: Return this value after handling the received data. ERR_ABRT: Only return ERR_ABRT if you want to abort the socket from within the callback function!

memberdef.definition: typedef err_t(* socket_recv_ip_rpt_fn) (u8 skt_num, u16 datalen, u8 *ipsrc, u16 port, err_t err)
memberdef.argsstring: )(u8 skt_num, u16 datalen, u8 *ipsrc, u16 port, err_t err)
memberdef.name: socket_recv_ip_rpt_fn

briefdescription.para: This Function prototype for socket srce ip callback functions. Called when data has been received.

parameterdescription.para: Is the socket number that returned by tls_socket_create function.
The received data length
source ip addr
source port
An error code if there has been an error receiving, always be ERR_OK when cs mode is udp.

return value is only valid for UDP receive, for udp it means nothing. ERR_OK: Return this value after handling the received data. ERR_ABRT: Only return ERR_ABRT if you want to abort the socket from within the callback function!

memberdef.definition: typedef err_t(* socket_connected_fn) (u8 skt_num, err_t err)
memberdef.name: socket_connected_fn

briefdescription.para: This Function prototype for tcp connected callback functions. Called when connected to the remote side.

parameterdescription.para: Is the socket number that returned by tls_socket_create function.
An unused error code, always ERR_OK currently.
Return this value after handling your logic.
Only return ERR_ABRT if you want to abort the socket from within the callback function!

briefdescription.para: This Function prototype for tcp poll callback functions. Called periodically.

parameterdescription.para: Is the socket number that returned by tls_socket_create function.
Try to do something periodically.
Only return ERR_ABRT if you want to abort the socket from within the callback function!

memberdef.definition: typedef err_t(* socket_accept_fn) (u8 skt_num, err_t err)
memberdef.name: socket_accept_fn

briefdescription.para: This Function prototype for tcp accept callback functions. Called when a new connection can be accepted on a listening tcp.

parameterdescription.para: Is the socket number that returned by tls_socket_create function.
An error code if there has been an error accepting.
Return this value after handling your logic.
Only return ERR_ABRT if you want to abort the socket from within the callback function!

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* socket_state_changed_fn) (u8 skt_num, u8 event, u8 state)
memberdef.name: socket_state_changed_fn

briefdescription.para: This Function prototype for socket state changed callback functions. Called when socket the sockte's state changed.

parameterdescription.para: Is the socket number that returned by tls_socket_create function.
Is the event number, see socket event defination.
Is the socket state, see socket state defination.

briefdescription.para: This function is called by your application code to create a socket.

parameterdescription.para: Is a pointer to an tls_socket_desc.
If create socket successfully. negative number If an error was detected.

briefdescription.para: This function is called by your application code to send data by the socket.

parameterdescription.para: Is the socket number that returned by tls_socket_create function.
Is a pointer to the data which need to be send by the socket.
The data's length.
If send data successfully. negative number If an error was detected.

briefdescription.para: This function is called by your application code to close the socket, and the related resources would be released.

parameterdescription.para: Is the socket number that returned by tls_socket_create function.
If close socket successfully. negative number If an error was detected.

briefdescription.para: This function is called by your application code to get the socket status of specified socket num.

parameterdescription.para: Is the socket number that returned by tls_socket_create function.
Is a pointer to the data contains the socket status, if the socket is server, also contains it's client's status.
The buf's length. At least, the len should be bigger than sizeof(struct tls_skt_status_t).
If send data successfully. negative number If an error was detected.

memberdef.argsstring: (u16 localport, u8 *ip_addr, u16 port, void *pdata, u16 len)
memberdef.name: tls_socket_udp_sendto

briefdescription.para: This function is called by your application code to send data by udp socket.

parameterdescription.para: This function will search all created sockets, if there is a socket whose localport equals this value and it's protocol is udp, then send the data by this socket, otherwise, nothing to send.
Is the remote ip address.
Is the remote port which upd send to.
Is a pointer to the data which need to be send by the socket.
The data's length.
If send data successfully. negative number If an error was detected.

briefdescription.para: This Function allocates a pbuf of the given type (possibly a chain for PBUF_POOL type).

detaileddescription.para: The actual memory allocated for the pbuf is determined by the layer at which the pbuf is allocated and the requested size (from the size parameter).

parameterdescription.para: layer flag to define header size
size of the pbuf's payload
this parameter decides how and where the pbuf
allocated pbuf. If multiple pbufs where allocated, this is the first pbuf of a pbuf chain.

briefdescription.para: This Function for release the buffer that you receive within the socket_recv_fn callback function. Attention please: If you return ERR_OK in the socket_recv_fn callback function, you must call this function to release the buffer by yourself. Otherwise, the buffer do not need be released by your code.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer you received in the socket_recv_fn callback function.
number of de-allocated pbufs

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct pbuf *p, void *dataptr, u16_t len, u16_t offset)
memberdef.name: pbuf_copy_partial

briefdescription.para: This Function for copy (part of) the contents of a packet buffer to an application supplied buffer.

parameterdescription.para: the pbuf from which to copy data.
the application supplied buffer
length of data to copy (dataptr must be big enough). No more than buf->tot_len will be copied, irrespective of len
offset into the packet buffer from where to begin copying len bytes
number of bytes copied, or 0 on failure
